intro: Blepharistemma corymbosum, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slight pubescence, while the flowers range in color from white to pale blue. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
